instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR: What is PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR? PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR is PPBUS_G3H after it has passed through a backlight fuse and a transistor that allows power through when BKLT_PLT_RST_L and LCD_BKLT_EN are present. .
definitions.Q9706: What is Q9706? Q9706 takes PPBUS_G3H's vltage and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q9706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R9788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q9706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..
definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2915B: What is 820-2915B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now
threads.message:
Hi, 
I received a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 15" 2011 board that had the gMux hardwired to bypass the external AMD chip and was asked to do the gMux firmware update that allows brightness control. Upon removing the several wires that are involved in the bypass, I was able to reprogram the gMux using DosDude's firmware update but now the display is not showing a backlight.

Looked at <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> fail and I've checked <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> is 33ohms, <RESISTOR>R9693</RESISTOR> is 100k ohms, <CAPACITOR>C9704</CAPACITOR> is not shorted to ground.

Also checked Pin 2 on <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> (<CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>) that enable is 3.3V

<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> is only 8.8 mV, so I hard wired <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> to 3.3V and still no backlight

Also checked Output on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> is only set to 12.5v,

I've reballed <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> hoping to resolve some poor connection on the pads but no difference, should I assume the Backlight IC is toast?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground on return lines; be sure all resistors are good.

Do you have now both <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM with 3V?
Did you try PRAM reset (2-3 times)?

Did you try another (compatible) LCD assembly?

<CHIP>U9701</CHIP> gets 3V3 and 5V?
Check if <DIODE>D9701</DIODE> is not shorted.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now
threads.message:
Tried the PRAM reset 3 times - No change
Swapped LCD with anther - No change
Both <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM are now 3V (remember I have wired <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> high with a wire, is was only 8.8 mV)
Checks all the LCD return line resistors that are basically wires (0 ohms) - No issue
Diode mode <RESISTOR>R9717</RESISTOR> = 627, <RESISTOR>R9718</RESISTOR> = 628, <RESISTOR>R9719</RESISTOR> = 628, <RESISTOR>R9720</RESISTOR> = 626, <RESISTOR>R9721</RESISTOR> = 626, <RESISTOR>R9722</RESISTOR> = 625
<CHIP>U9701</CHIP> has 5V for VIN and 3.3V for VDDIO (measured off <CAPACITOR>C9711</CAPACITOR>)
<DIODE>D9701</DIODE> was not shorted.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now
threads.message:
Change <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>.
Once removed, check continuity from A5 ball to K/<DIODE>D9701</DIODE>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now
threads.message:
Replaced <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>, no issue with A5 to K/<DIODE>D9701</DIODE>.

Had to have hard wired <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> to 3.3V to see any video. So I can see some video now but on boot-up I see some lines on apple logo when it starts and video is shaking, background goes to total 'Red' when I shutdown computer.

threads.message:
In the previous post I still had <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> hardwired as indicated on the previous message, guess I should have mentioned it was still hardwired.

Took voltage 3.3 volts from the JTAG connector J9600 Pin 1. Also previously checked that <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> Pin 1 was connected to <RESISTOR>R9693</RESISTOR> Pin 1 as I didn't understand why <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> was not providing 3.3 volts.

threads.message:
I have not tried to tie both <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> together as I just thought it was quicker to take 3.3v from JTAG connector.

As I shutdown the MacOS the screen goes into some weird 'Red' colour as I'm shutting it down. Screen then goes black when the computer is off.
Video seems to have a significant sync type issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now
threads.message: You've got 3V from a power rail which disappear later than the image!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now
threads.message: So is the recommendation to tie the <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> to supply power to <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL>? Do you believe this will resolve the video shake issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now
threads.message:
Didn't try yet???
Backlight must appear AFTER image is enabled, and should go off BEFORE image dissapears.
Just to avoid any artifacts on the screen...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now
threads.message:
Well apparently <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> is not providing 3V.....Not sure what I was checked before but apparently not the correct thing.

<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> is only in the mV's.....since I bridged <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> the display is no longer visible since Backlight is not enabled.

threads.message: Remove the bridge and check again <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>; do NOT tied it to ground...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now
threads.message:
"<TRANSISTOR>Q9707</TRANSISTOR> - Pin 4 - 12.58v, Pin 3 - 4.1v, Pin 1,2,5,6 - 12.58v"
Do you mean <TRANSISTOR>Q9706</TRANSISTOR>, no?
However, these are good voltages for [B][U]<TRANSISTOR>Q9706</TRANSISTOR>[/U][/B].

<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> is not good.
Remove <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> and tie together <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM.

GMUX flashed correctly for sure?
Did you remove <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR>/11?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now

Also Removed <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR> and R8911as well..

Apple Logo shows up full brightness on boot but display seem to turns off on Login screen.

Not sure if GMUX flashed properly but demux utility won't allow me to use the license that it showed consumed initially

New file cannot be flashed over the last you did.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now
threads.message:
Was able to flash with the original JED file.....screen went black on boot.

Flashed the working JED file....now the screen flashes the top of the screen on Apple logo bootup and then goes dark at the end (No image, looks like backlight is lite up....but no login screen is shown.

Performed FLASH Erase, Program & Verify for both files in the Lattice Diamond Programmer.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now
threads.message:
"Upon removing the several wires that are involved in the bypass"
No idea what this mean.
Put back all things, only remove <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR>/11.

BTW, remove L2406, when you work with Lattice programmer (hot air needed).
Personally, I prefer to remove <RESISTOR>R2415</RESISTOR> instead; more easy to do with JBC microtwezer...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now
threads.message:
Are you tell me to  put back <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> and disconnect the <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> now?

The Lattice programmer indicated that the programming worked, are you saying that I should redo this with L2406 removed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now
threads.message:
You should put the board in original state, only remove <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR>/11.
In my case, I have never got the programmer working without removing L2406, or <RESISTOR>R2415</RESISTOR>.

You should flash the "<SIGNAL>COME_BACK</SIGNAL>" jed before trying the conversion file.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now
threads.message:
Board back to original state.
Removed <RESISTOR>R2415</RESISTOR>.
Reprogrammed again the '<SIGNAL>COME_BACK</SIGNAL>' jed file then the 'working' file.
Put back the <RESISTOR>R2415</RESISTOR> after programming.

Still have the same weird behaviour......flashing portion of screen during apple logo then goes dark.

threads.message:
The board is a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.... the working file seems to be the issue with the video at boot...

I found a generic <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>/2914 jed file ([URL]https://github.com/ayilm1/gMUXBypass).....and[/URL] tried it....had only success in stopping the flickering......on the boot....after the apple logo the screen goes black and the backlight looks like it remains on.....can't see the login screen as yet.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gMux Firmware updated but no blacklight now
